channel.title: How to make yourself mod/admin
channel.description:
Hey, I started to look into making my own server yesterday. So far I've figuiered (spelling?) a few things out. I need to know how to make myself a Mon/Admin. Would I need to make my server a no-ip first? Or just keep using the Testscape source until it's done, then make no-ip?
Thanks if you help me.
Please don't post things like "r0fl u n00b, u dnt 3v3n kn0 dat! l00l!".[br][size=1]Posted on: March 11, 2007, 07:08:00 AM[/size][hr]I'm using Testscape btw.[br][size=1]Posted on: March 11, 2007, 07:08:56 AM[/size][hr]Anyone out there willing to help me? :|[br][size=1]Posted on: March 11, 2007, 07:21:42 AM[/size][hr]No one? :|

item.title: How to make yourself mod/admin
item.dc:creator: @leder678 leder678
item.description:
@leder678 wrote:

To make ur User Search for

 //start of moderator/admin list, 1 = mod, 2 = staff, 3 = admin

And under that u will see something like this:

    else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Username here"))
				{
					playerRights = 3; 
				}
    else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Username here"))
				{
					playerRights = 2; 
				}
   else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Username here"))
				{
					playerRights = 2;
				}
   else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Username here"))
				{
					playerRights = 2;
				}
   else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Username here"))
				{
					playerRights = 2;
				}
   else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Username here"))
				{
					playerRights = 2;
				}
   else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Username here"))
				{
					playerRights = 2;
				}
   else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Username here")) 
				{
					playerRights = 2; 
				}
   else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Username here"))
				{
					playerRights = 2;
				}
   else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Username here"))
				{
					playerRights = 2;
				}
   else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Username here"))
				{
					playerRights = 2;
				}
   else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Username here"))
				{
					playerRights = 1;
				}
   else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Username here"))
				{
					playerRights = 1;
				}

If i dont think wrong the playerRights = 3; does not work so make it playerRights = 2;

Read full topic

item.description:
@jonaske wrote:

yes me =D

look u go into folder characters then u open ur name or sombody else u wanna make
u see character-… lots of time , go under the last line off the character and typ it again but typ now character-rights = 1,2or3

jonaske

Files compiled successfully!
Press any key to continue . . .[br][size=1]Posted on: March 11, 2007, 08:02:23 AM[/size][hr]I’m guessin’ I should declare (whatever that means) something in client.java[br][size=1]Posted on: March 11, 2007, 08:03:04 AM[/size][hr]No one? item.title: How to make yourself mod/admin
item.dc:creator: @alboblood88 alboblood88
item.description:
@alboblood88 wrote:

a easier way is to go to character folder and click the name i want to make an admin or mod then go to player rights and change the 0 to 1 for mod 2 for admin 3 for owner…
